articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Hussam Al-Masri
articles.description: Israel stepped up its air and ground offensive in Gaza with more attacks on Hamas militants and command posts on Monday as both sides marked the first anniversary of a war that has destroyed much of the territory and changed Palestinians' lives forever.
articles.title: Israel steps up Gaza bombing as Palestinians mark war's first anniversary

articles.author: Steven Scheer, Yomna Ehab
articles.description: Hezbollah rockets hit Israel's third-largest city of Haifa, police said early on Monday, and Israeli media reported 10 injured in the country's north on the first anniversary of the Gaza war, which has spread in the Middle East.
articles.title: Hezbollah strikes Israel on Gaza war anniversary; fears grow over Middle East instability

articles.author: Manuel Ausloos
articles.description: Israelis on Monday marked the first anniversary of the devastating Hamas attack that triggered a war which has sparked protest worldwide and risks igniting a far wider conflict in the Middle East.
articles.title: Israel marks Oct. 7 anniversary under shadow of escalating war

articles.author: Niklas Pollard, Ludwig Burger
articles.description: U.S. scientists Victor Ambros and Gary Ruvkun won the 2024 Nobel Prize in Medicine for the discovery of microRNA and its crucial role in how multicellular organisms grow and live, the award-giving body said on Monday.
articles.title: Nobel prize for medicine: US duo Ambros and Ruvkun win for work on microRNA

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The head of a rotating presidency that is running Haiti said on Monday that he would not ratify the handover to the man in line to take over from him, citing unresolved corruption accusations against three other council members.
articles.title: Haiti's divided transition council in dispute over new president

articles.author: Anthony Boadle
articles.description: Centrist and center-right parties won city halls and consolidated control of town councils across Brazil in Sunday's municipal elections, underscoring a conservative shift in the country's electorate as the ruling Workers Party lost ground.
articles.title: Brazil mayoral elections bolster center-right ahead of 2026 presidential race

articles.author: Fedja Grulovic
articles.description: Rescuers found another body on Monday in their search for survivors of devastating floods and landslides that swept across Bosnia three days ago, taking the death toll to at least 20.
articles.title: Rescuers, villagers search for missing after Bosnia devastating floods

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The mayor of the capital of Mexico's violence-plagued state of Guerrero was killed on Sunday less than a week after he took office, the state's governor confirmed.
articles.title: Mexican mayor assassinated days after taking office

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: In the past year in the Gaza Strip, Israel has bombed more than 40,000 targets, found 4,700 tunnel shafts and destroyed 1,000 rocket launcher sites, the military said on Monday's one-year anniversary of the Hamas-led militant attacks that triggered Israel's assault on the enclave.
articles.title: In one year of war, Israel strikes 40,000 Hamas targets in Gaza

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Ukrainian sabotage operation has damaged a Russian minesweeping vessel in Russia's Kaliningrad region and put it out of action, Ukraine's military spy agency said on Monday.
articles.title: Ukrainian sabotage damages Russian ship in Baltic Sea, Kyiv says
